title: Restaurant accidentally serves hash cake at funeral leaving 13 mourners high

Mourners at a funeral were served cake laced with cannabis in an error which led to 13 people needing medical treatment.

German media reports 13 guests suffered nausea or dizziness at the funeral in Rostock after eating the 'hash cake'.

In what is a custom in Germany, mourners went to a memorial service at a restaurant where an employee had accidentally brought the hash cake along with regular cakes booked for the occasion.

German news site Welt reports the police are now investigating the female employee's daughter.

They report the employee did not know it contained the intoxicating ingredient, while her 18-year-old daughter regularly prepares cake for events.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

A Rostock police spokesman said the mum had "taken another one from the freezer without discussing it with the daughter."

The incident took place in August but has only come out now after German newspaper Bild reported it on Tuesday, forcing police to confirm the details.

Welt reports police did not want to report it at the time as they did not want to add to the grief of the family.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

A police spokesman said the local force learnt about it "late in the evening when participants came to the Lichtenhagen police station to file a complaint."

Welt reports that the widow of the deceased was among the 13 victims.

One woman was taken to hospital in an ambulance during the funeral and others sought medical treatment later in the day.

The 18-year-old daughter is under investigation for various charges relating to narcotics, causing injury to the 13 guests and for disturbing the funeral.
description: An 18-year-old is being investigated after 13 mourners suffered nausea or dizziness at the traditional memorial service in Germany
